intro: Phelipanche purpurea subsp. bohemica, commonly known as the Bohemian yellow sandparsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is a biennial or perennial herb that typically grows in dry, sandy soils across southern Europe. The plant features a taproot with a fibrous root system and produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately divided and often have a distinctive aromatic scent. The species is adapted to arid environments and is often found in disturbed or marginal habitats.
